About Us
The Conner Family Story
The Conner Family Story
The Conner Family Story
The Conner Family Story
The Conner Family Story
In December 2002, two weeks before Christmas, Eddie Conner, a 5th generation farmer in Nassau County, found himself out of a job. A knock at the door that day, 2 hours before it was reported on the TV, brought the news that Mr. Conner and 88 other poultry growers were effectively put out of business. Tyson was closing the doors to their poultry operation in north Florida.
As fate would have it, Amanda McLendon, the Conner’s daughter, and a friend, Beth Gregory, who worked at Farm Bureau in Callahan, had read about and visited a corn maze in Jennings FL two years before.  They returned so excited they wanted Mr. Conner to open a maze on the family farm immediately!!!  Mr. Conner, having his hands full with 4 poultry houses, producing approx. 400,000 chickens a year, plus cattle and hay, told Amanda she was crazy.  He did not have time for such nonsense.
As the days went by, after Tyson closing, the Conner’s were concerned about what they would do to make a living.  As they discussed  various options, God brought to their memory the trip Amanda and Beth had made to a maze in Jennings, and now maybe it would be something to try.  So they prayed and ask God to guide them, did some research on the internet, talked to their children, and visited two Florida mazes.  After the farmer who owned the maze in Jennings made the statement, “It has been the most fun in farming I have ever had”; the Conner’s took a giant leap of faith and joined the Maize organization.
Then The Work Began...
Having replanted the maze 3 times due to the weather, Conner’s A-Maize-Ing Acres finally opened October 18, 2003.  The Conner’s inaugural season was a huge success, helping approximately 12,000 people “Get Lost” while being dedicated to providing a place where families, can come together and enjoy good clean fun.  Conner’s A-Maize-Ing Acres was host to over 6,000 school children on field trips their first year.  The teachers and students gave the Conner’s high marks on education, organization and a whole lot of good carefree fun.
The Conner’s strive to educate the public on the importance of agriculture and the American farmer.
They are quick to tell you that without God’s blessings and the help of family, friends and their church family, they could have never made it.
Meet our farm family
Mr. Eddie and Mrs. Betty Jean
Mr. Eddie and Mrs. Betty Jean
Mr. Eddie and Mrs. Betty Jean
Raised on the farm with his siblings, Mr Eddie helped his family farm this land for years. At the age of 18, Eddie enlisted in the Army and fought in the Vietnam War. Soon after his return, Betty Jean and Eddie were married in 1972 and together they farmed and raised their children (Amanda, Eddie II and  Matthew) with the help of the Lord
Show More
Raised on the farm with his siblings, Mr Eddie helped his family farm this land for years. At the age of 18, Eddie enlisted in the Army and fought in the Vietnam War. Soon after his return, Betty Jean and Eddie were married in 1972 and together they farmed and raised their children (Amanda, Eddie II and  Matthew) with the help of the Lord. They continue to farm with their Children and Grandchildren.
Show Less
Our Staff
Mr. Eddie and Mrs. Betty Jean
Mr. Eddie and Mrs. Betty Jean
Many of the staff are family members and friends. Among those who have worked closely with the Conner's are: Conner son Lil' Eddie, Michelle, Sarah and her family, Kylie and so many more. They continue to be grateful for all the support, love and prayers from the fabulous farm hands they employ each year. After a brief morning prayer, the
Show More
Many of the staff are family members and friends. Among those who have worked closely with the Conner's are: Conner son Lil' Eddie, Michelle, Sarah and her family, Kylie and so many more. They continue to be grateful for all the support, love and prayers from the fabulous farm hands they employ each year. After a brief morning prayer, the farm hands are ready to greet and assist guests and help make their day special.
Show Less
The McLendon Girls
Mr. Eddie and Mrs. Betty Jean
The McLendon Girls
Amanda Conner McLendon is the oldest child born to Eddie and Betty Jean Conner.   Helping her parents, she manages the farm  while it is opened to guests throughout the year and together with her husband has raised their three beautiful daughters on the farm where they enjoy working together as family.   Hope, Kara and Cierra McLendon (
Show More
Amanda Conner McLendon is the oldest child born to Eddie and Betty Jean Conner.   Helping her parents, she manages the farm  while it is opened to guests throughout the year and together with her husband has raised their three beautiful daughters on the farm where they enjoy working together as family.   Hope, Kara and Cierra McLendon (aka "the girls") are a big part of the Fall Season attractions as well as everyday farm life.
Show Less
The Conners
Meet the Farmer, Mr. Eddie, & his Daughter, Amanda McLendon!

Experience Conner's A-Maize-Ing Acres 2025 EVENTS
We’re excited for the 2025 season and are busy getting ready for all of you to have a farmtastic fun time!
2025 Fall Festival at Conners A-Maize-Ing Acres
Peaceful Friday - October 3rd
October 3rd - 4pm to 10pm
Escape the rush and discover a quieter, more enjoyable farm experience by visiting us on Fridays!
Be the first to visit the farm this fall!
Our farm is buzzing with excitement while offering you the tranquility you deserve.
Enjoy a leisurely day filled with delicious bites from our food trucks, engage in delightful farm activities, and soak up the scenic surroundings. It's the ultimate blend of fun and relaxation, perfectly timed before the weekend crowds roll in. Whether it's a family outing or a solo adventure, Fridays at the farm are simply unbeatable. We hope to see you there soon!
Opening Saturday - October 4th Fall Vendor Market & Grandparents Day
Today we're celebrating the special bond between grandparents and grandchildren
with an exciting
Grandparent's Day event from
10am to 10 pm!
What better way to honor this cherished relationship than with a day full of laughter and joy on the farm?
Grandparents enter free when accompanied by their grandchildren, making it a wonderful opportunity for family bonding.
Our event features a delightful
Vendor Market (10am to 4pm)
with a variety of mouth-watering options from food trucks, and farmtastic activities that guarantee a memorable day for all ages.
Whether it’s enjoying the fresh air, indulging in tasty treats, or exploring the lively vendor stalls, there’s something for everyone. Don’t miss experiencing family fun at its finest—make sure to bring your loved ones for a picture-perfect day on the farm!
Peaceful Fridays - October 10th & 17th
October 10th - 4pm to 10pm
October 17th - 4pm to 10pm
Escape the rush and discover a quieter, more enjoyable farm experience by visiting us on Fridays!
Our farm is buzzing with excitement while offering you the tranquility you deserve.
Enjoy a leisurely day filled with delicious bites from our food trucks, engage in delightful farm activities, and soak up the scenic surroundings. It's the ultimate blend of fun and relaxation, perfectly timed before the weekend crowds roll in. Whether it's a family outing or a solo adventure, Fridays at the farm are simply unbeatable. We hope to see you there soon!
Redneck Olympics - October11th
October 11th from 10am to 10pm
Heads up, fun-seekers!
We are thrilled to announce a full day of Farmtastic Fun with our upcoming
Redneck Olympic Games
scheduled from 11am to 2pm!
We’ve lined up a thrilling day filled with exciting farm activities and delectable treats from our diverse food trucks. Whether you’re in it to compete or just enjoy the spectacle, there is something for everyone.
Don’t miss out on this unique experience that promises excitement, laughter, and a day to remember.
Be sure to look out for our sign-up sheet going live in October to guarantee your spot in the fun!
October 17th & 18th - Non Scary Sunset Wagon Rides
Ready for a magical adventure?
Begin your evening at sunset and journey through the woods on a magical wagon ride!
On cloudless nights when the stars are beautifully bright and abundant, fall in love with the serenity & peacefullness  of the country.
October 17th & 18th
Non scary magical wagon rides
Pumpkinfest - October 18th
Mark your calendars for
October 18th, 10am to 10pm
and prepare for a day filled with excitement, flavors, and farm-inspired adventure! From 10 AM to 10 PM, our Farmtastic Farm offers a delightful mix of activities for all ages. Enjoy a diverse selection of food options from our mouth-watering food trucks, engage in exciting farm activities, and create memorable moments with your loved ones in a vibrant setting. Whether you're seeking a relaxing day outdoors or a family-friendly adventure, we have it all covered. Make sure to join us for this Farmtastic  day.
Field of Screams - October 24th
Are you ready to face your fears?
The Field of Screams is back for two nights of heart-pounding excitement on
October 24th and 25th, from dark until 10pm.
This exclusive reservation-only event promises to deliver terror beyond your wildest nightmares, featuring terrifying haunts and the best local food trucks to keep you fueled amidst the scares. Whether you're a thrill-seeker or just looking for an unforgettable night out, this is your chance to experience a terrifyingly good time.
Fall Fun Day - October 25th
Get ready for an unforgettable family adventure at our
Trick or Treat Scavenger Hunt
October 25th, from 10 AM to 5 PM!
The first 200 kids will snag a goody bag, and our thrilling
Costume Contest kicks off at 3 PM
Don’t miss your chance to win!
With food trucks, exciting farm activities, and tons of Farmtastic Fun, there's something for everyone.
~~~Daytime maze closes at 5pm~~~
For the brave-hearted, dare to enter the FIELD OF SCREAMS
from dark to 10 PM (reservations required).
See you on the farm!
(Field of Screams - RESERVATION ONLY
DARK TO 10PM
Autism and Related Disabilities Day - November 1st
Autism and Related Disabilities Day - November 1st
Autism and Related Disabilities Fun Day
Brought to you by
Northeast Florida Advocates for The Arc
Nassau
November 1st—a special day crafted for families seeking a supportive and fun environment.
This unique event offers exclusive access to our farm, free from the usual crowds and distractions, ensuring a comfortable experience for everyone. Engage with the thoughtfully designed educational booths and explore the farm at your own pace. The event is strictly by reservation, and tickets will be available soon. Don’t miss this opportunity for your family to enjoy a day filled with fun, learning, and community connection. Stay tuned for ticket release and secure your spot for an unforgettable experience!
Praise in the Maize - Nov 1st
Autism and Related Disabilities Day - November 1st
Join us for
"Praise in the Maize"
Saturday, November 1st,  6 pm to 10 pm!
Immerse yourself in an evening of uplifting praise and worship under a canopy of stars. This event offers more than just music; enjoy a live Praise & Worship band, a meaningful devotional message, and the farm's nighttime wonders, including a wagon ride
and moonlit maze.
Gather around the campfire to roast marshmallows or savor s'mores, and treat your taste buds at our  selection of food, dessert, and coffee trucks available on-site.
Whether you're drawn by the spiritual journey, the captivating activities, or simply the joy of community, this event promises something for everyone. Bring along family and friends for an inspiring night of connection and celebration. Admissions details will be announced soon – keep an eye out and join us as we light up the night with joy and praise!
Veteran’s Day - Nov. 11th
Veteran’s Day - Nov. 11th
Join us on November 11th, 10am to 2pm
to honor the brave individuals who have served our country.
Our Veterans Day celebration starts at 10 AM and offers a perfect blend of gratitude and entertainment.
At 11 AM, we'll be hosting a special ceremony to recognize the sacrifices of our Veterans, and you're invited
to be a part of it.
Afterward, immerse yourself in the festive atmosphere with a variety of food trucks ready to satisfy your cravings, and enjoy the farm activities designed
for both kids and adults.
It’s a day brimming with Farmtastic fun and community spirit.
We’d love to see you there.
FREE ADMISSION for
Veterans & Active Military, their spouses and dependent children.

General Admission Tickets

Farmtastic Birthdays and Special Events
In Season Birthday Parties
Want to give your child a Birthday Party
they and their friends will be talking about forever?
Book your party where the fun and good times never end!!!
$450 for 30 people 3hrs. in our party barn area.
You and your guest are welcome to stay at the farm
from the time it opens to closing.
$10 each additional guest
wagon ride, Cow train and Animal barn included.
Pay Deposit Here
Off Season Birthday Parties
$450 for 3hrs. for up to 50 people
$10 each additional person $100 each additional hour.
Included: Large covered barn with picnic tables & play area
Add Ons
Wagon ride - to feed the cows- $100
Cow train - to ride guest around the farm, see all the farm sights, visit and feed the animals at the barn $50
Fire pits- 2 fire pits , 2 s'mores per guest with attendant
*Only available during cold months* $200
Horse Rides * contact us for pricing
Pay Deposit here
LARGE GROUPS & EVENTS   (Deposit $500.00)
Pay Deposit here
